org.apache.hc.core5.http.message

Class AbstractHttpMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hc.core5.http.message.HeaderGroup
      • org.apache.hc.core5.http.message.AbstractHttpMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, HttpMessage<HttpEntity>, MessageHead
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicHttpRequest, BasicHttpResponse

    public abstract class AbstractHttpMessage
extends HeaderGroup
implements HttpMessage<HttpEntity>
    Basic implementation of HttpMessage.
    Since:
    4.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String name,
                      Object value)
        Description copied from interface: HttpMessage
        Adds a header to this message. The header will be appended to the end of the list.
        Specified by:
        addHeader in interface HttpMessage<HttpEntity>
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header.
        value - the value of the header, taken as the value's Object.toString().

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(String name,
                      Object value)
        Description copied from interface: HttpMessage
        Overwrites the first header with the same name. The new header will be appended to the end of the list, if no header with the given name can be found.
        Specified by:
        setHeader in interface HttpMessage<HttpEntity>
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header.
        value - the value of the header, taken as the value's Object.toString().

      • getEntity

        public HttpEntity getEntity()
        Description copied from interface: HttpMessage
        Obtains the message entity, if available.
        Specified by:
        getEntity in interface HttpMessage<HttpEntity>
        Returns:
        the message entity, or null if not available

      • setEntity

        public void setEntity(HttpEntity entity)
        Description copied from interface: HttpMessage
        Sets an entity for this message.

        Please note that if an entity has already been set it is responsibility of the caller to ensure release of the resources that may be associated with that entity.

        Specified by:
        setEntity in interface HttpMessage<HttpEntity>
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to set of this message, or null to unset
